thread.title: Results Wrap: Reporting season blog August 10
thread.title_full: Results Wrap: Reporting season blog August 10 | afr.com

author: afr.com
title: Results Wrap: Reporting season blog August 10
text:
Bendigo and Adelaide Bank's annual results were expected to benefit from further house price rises supplied 11.08am: Chanticleer | Capital raisings and lending dominates bank results: Volatility is the new normal in the banking sector as years of stable and consistent earnings growth is overshadowed by tough new capital requirements, a clampdown on investor home lending and the bigger economic picture.
11am: The earnings results today have seen shares in Ansell fall 17 per cent to $20.48, JB Hi-Fi's results were well received with the retailer's shares rising 8.7 per cent to $21.31, National Australia Bank is little changed, down 0.3 per cent to $32.71. Bendigo and Adelaide's shares fell 3.8 per cent to $12.48.
9.55am: Bionomics Ltd said its loss for the year ended June 30 was $16.9 million, down 629 per cent on a year ago while revenue slumped 40 per cent to $16.6 million. Cash as at June 30 soared 178 per cent to $26.6 million. The company has no plans to pay any dividend for the year.
9.20am: Catapult said its revenue for the year ended June 30 was $11.8 million, compared with its forecast of $9.4 million. EBITDA was $4.6 million loss, which was better than its estimated $5.2 million loss for the period while its net loss of $4.3 million was 12 per cent better than its estimated $4.9 million loss.
9.10am: DWS Ltd said net profit after tax for the year ended June 30 fell 19 per cent on a year ago to $10.4 million while revenue inched $200,000 higher to $94.6 million. The company will pay a final fully franked dividend of 3.75c a share on October 2.
 9am: Coffey International has posted a net loss of $18.1 million for the full year, from a net profit after tax of $4.4 million a year ago due to a non-cash goodwill impairment of $12.2 million. The company's revenue fell to $579.1 million from $628.1 million. It will not be paying a dividend. Managing director John Douglas said: "We've taken decisive action to match capacity to markets and reposition our Geoservices business."
"With many new infrastructure projects about to begin, we have the right people in the right locations to win work and drive profitable growth."
8.55am: Bendigo and Adelaide Bank has announced an after tax profit of $423.9 million for the 12 months ended June 30. It will pay a final fully franked dividend of 33c a share.
8.49am: JB Hi-Fi said its net profit after tax rose 6.4 per cent to $136.51 million in the year ended June 30 from the year-earlier $128.4 million. Revenue gained 4.8 per cent to $3.652 billion from $3.484 billion, the home appliance and electronics good retailer told the Australian Stock Exchange. It will pay a final dividend of 31 cents on September 11.
The retailer also announced it would buy back $15.2 million of its shares to offset the dilutionary impact of shares issued as part of the employee share options scheme.
8.45am: G8 Education's net profit for the half-year ended June 30 soared 73 per cent to $28.2 million with revenue jumping 66 per cent to $310.9 million. The company will pay a current annual dividend of 24c, fully franked and to be paid quarterly.
8.40am: Condom and rubber glove maker Ansell said its full-year underlying profit tax totalled $US187.5 million from $US157 million, as revenue edged higher by 3.5 per cent to $US1.645 billion. The company said it will pay a 23 cent dividend to shareholders of record on September 10.
8.31am: National Australia Bank said its third-quarter statutory cash profit rose 9 per cent from a year ago to $1.75 billion. Statutory unaudited net profit totalled about $1.85 billion, the bank said in a statement to the ASX. NAB said it was making substantial progress on its planned IPO of its UK subsidiary Clydesdale Bank. It added that its charge for bad debts fell 15 per cent to $193 million and common equity Tier 1 ratio stood at 9.94 per cent as of June 30.
For all company results, visit the AFR 2015 full-year reporting calendar.
